intro: Gagea lutea var. australis, commonly known as the Australian yellow gagea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a small, bulbous perennial that produces delicate, clustered white or pale yellow flowers in spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is adapted to dry, sandy soils. It is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Amaryllidaceae family.
